Source.Name: composefs
Source.Summary: The reliability of disk images, the flexibility of files
Source.Description:
The composefs project combines several underlying Linux features to provide a very flexible mechanism to support read-only mountable filesystem trees, stacking on top of an underlying "lower" Linux filesystem.
The key technologies composefs uses are: - overlayfs as the kernel interface - EROFS for a mountable metadata tree - fs-verity (optional) from the lower filesystem
